entry.title: Android OS manager uses the same request ID for all triggers
entry.content:
The first one to complete will successfully have its callback invoked, but any subsequent ones will see that the corresponding callback doesn't exist. This leads to incorrect behavior in the `AttributionManagerImpl` as the callback is invoked *before* all the registrations have been completed, and the `success` value will only reflect the success of the first registration, not any subsequent ones.
https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/attribution_reporting/attribution_os_level_manager_android.cc;l=208-211;drc=291e237516f017c890576f0f0c6edf43bc7d9450
https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/public/android/java/src/org/chromium/content/browser/AttributionOsLevelManager.java;l=371-388;drc=291e237516f017c890576f0f0c6edf43bc7d9450
https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/attribution_reporting/attribution_os_level_manager_android.cc;l=254-256;drc=291e237516f017c890576f0f0c6edf43bc7d9450

entry.title: Tests are failing: fend_core_unittest.cc(34): Value of: result\nExpected: value is equal to 0x55f424de7920 pointing to \"3218.688 meters\"\n Actual: (nullopt), which ...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): fend_core_unittest.cc(34): Value of: result\nExpected: value is equal to 0x55f424de7920 pointing to \"3218.688 meters\"\n Actual: (nullopt), which is not engaged
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:unit_tests/FendCoreTest.UnitConversion
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/d8cccdb0d3c12779c453e93488c51392
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Do not forward-declare ConvertType template
entry.content:
There have been several spots where we've been bitten by _jni.h headers referring to types that are declared by headers that are #included after it.
E.g.: https://source.chromium.org/search?q=pcre:true%20%5C%2F%5C%2F.*%5Cn%23include.*_jni.h&ss=chromium
Another quirk of having it pre-declared is that you get linker errors if the signature of the specialization does not exactly match what the codegen expected (e.g. const vs non-const).
For these two reasons, I think it'd be better to prefer all `_jni.h` files to appear after the main `#include` list, and also to ensure that the `FromJniType`/`ToJniType` specializations that are being used appear in included headers.

entry.title: "prefers-color-scheme: dark" doesn't follow the Browser Appearance Dark/Light Mode Setting
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open a web page (e.g. https://www.google.com), then open devtools -> console 2. Run `window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches` 3. Open browser settings: chrome://settings/appearance , change the mode to light or dark.
I tested on macOS with the lasted Chrome: test-1: if OS theme is Light and Browser theme is Light, step-2 is false(Light) test-2: if OS theme is Light and Browser theme is Dark, step-2 is false(Light) test-3: if OS theme is Dark and Browser theme is Light, step-2 is true(Dark) test-4: if OS theme is Dark and Browser theme is Dark, step-2 is true(Dark)
# Problem Description At present, "prefers-color-scheme: dark" follows the OS dark/light theme, rather than the Browser dark/light theme. In my opinion, "prefers-color-scheme: dark" should follow the Browser dark/light theme, rather than the OS dark/light theme.
# Additional Comments On Firefox, "prefers-color-scheme: dark" follows the Browser dark/light theme, rather than the OS dark/light theme.
# Summary "prefers-color-scheme: dark" doesn't follow the Browser Appearance Dark/Light Mode Setting
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>CSS
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Enable OzoneBubblesUsePlatformWidgets on Linux
entry.content: Enable OzoneBubblesUsePlatformWidgets by default, or at least add it to chrome://flags and for linux users.

entry.title: Currently, "Delete Group" should be "Close Group"
Should pass navigate iframe lazyload WPTs
entry.content:
See https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/45650
These appear to be flaky in Chromium:
- html/semantics/embedded-content/the-iframe-element/iframe-loading-lazy-nav-form-submit.html - /html/semantics/embedded-content/the-iframe-element/iframe-loading-lazy-nav-location-replace-set-src.html - /html/semantics/embedded-content/the-iframe-element/iframe-loading-lazy-nav-meta-refresh.optional.html
This always fails:
- /html/semantics/embedded-content/the-iframe-element/iframe-loading-lazy-reload-navigation-reload.html

entry.title: [iPhone] Create Group screen - CTA "Create Group" group should be capitalized
[iPhone] to confirm - "Name this Group" text is too big
Crash when trying to remove last tab from group
Order of snapshot in the group cell is changing
[iPhone] When adding a tab to new group, the transition (animation of tab moving) is too pronounced
Spinner in the Tab Group takes a lot of time to animate
Select tab context menu action in the group view is broken / should not be displayed ?
Wrong update of the Tab Grid on iPad
Share action doesn't work in the group view context menu
Cannot drag&drop from group view to different window
Group name doesn't fit in the group view
Bug bash
[FedCM[ Refactor UKM recording
entry.content:
Currently we have all the FedCM related UKMs under the same event "FedCm": https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:tools/metrics/ukm/ukm.xml;l=4373?q=tools%2Fmetrics%2Fukm%2Fukm.xml
Ideally we should have separated events such as Blink.FedCm.Foo and Blink.FedCm.Bar which group related UKMs

entry.title: Responsive toolbar overflow button flashes in during toolbar animation
entry.content:
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Pin a few side panels (2) Open an unpinned side panel
What is the expected result? Assuming the browser width is large the overflow button shouldn't be seen during the animation
What happens instead? the overflow button is seen during the animation then gone again when the animation is over.

entry.title: User picked a color?
